data.title: Foreign Submission Pt 2
data.text:
101 minutes.

An old man lost in steppe and his grandson's search for him. From the director of the brilliant Kelin, which was nearly nominated in 2010, making the finalist list.

not selected but considered: The Student (Cannes 2012), loosely based on Crime & Punishment, Harmony Lessons (Berlin 2013), which looks at the increasingly global issue of high-school bullying anda Harmony Lessons has the buzz.

83 minutes. Latvian. Childhood Crime Drama.

A young boy enters a life of petty crime while trying to hide it from his mother.

Not selected: the basketball blockbuster Dream Team 1935, about Latvia's participation in the European Basketball championships, which is hoping for an international English-language release.

105 minutes. Spanish. Crime Drama.

a young girl and a policeman and the drug trade. This won Best Director at Cannes

Not Selected: Mexico's 14 finalists were... Passionate Pancho Villa, Cinco de Maya: the battle, Tooth for Tooth, The Award, Dream of Lu, Between Night and Day, Zebra, The Golden Cage, Early life and Sabina Rivas brief, The Walls Speak, The Catfish Unusual, Looks Multiple, I Do Not Want to Sleep Alone, No Refunds and Tlatelolco Summer of '68

112 minutes

Romanian. Drama

This Golden Bear winning film stars the acclaimed Luminita Gheorghiu who previously appeared in two of the country's most important exports (4 Months, 3 Weeks and 2 Days and The Death of Mr Lazarescu). Despite the country's super hot acclaim with critics, they've yet to be nominated.

98 minutes. Arabic. Drama

First Submission!

One of the more high profile titles since it's currently in release from Sony Pictures Classics. It's about a 10 year old free spirited girl in the suburbs always pushing boundaries. She wants a bike to compete with a neighborhood boy. Everyone loves a good backstory: it's the first submission from Saudi Arabia and their first film ever directed by a woman.

112 minutes

Ensemble Drama

This drama, which played at Sundance, focuses on five survivors of a "tragic heroic act" and revisits them 12 years later. (The poster almost looks like a still from The Hurt Locker).

Note: This director's previous film The Trap made the January finalist list but was not an Oscar nominee

104 minutes. Swedish & Croatian. Drama

An immigrant is laid off from her factory job in Sweden and faced with tough choices. The tag line is "you don't have a chance, take it." suggesting this is pretty dark (or darkly comic?) stuff.

Did not submit this year

We thought Kenya would be here with "Something Necessary"

AFGHANISTAN through JAPAN -

more submissions from all over the globe

Thank You

A.D., Ali, Guy, Irvin, Ivan, Ilya, Krister, Patrick, and Yonatan

Did not submit this year K-Z

We thought Kenya would be here with "Something Necessary". And no entry from Vietnam again.

90 minutes

Family Drama

This film with a very moody trailer is about a family with a deaf child.

Not selected: the gay box office hit Blue, Not So Pink
